$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have lymphoma.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA about your condition unless:

 - you develop problems with your brain or nervous system
 - your doctor has expressed concerns about your fitness to drive
 - you can only drive a specially adapted vehicle or a certain type of vehicle
 - your medication causes side effects that might make it unsafe for you to drive 

Check the [list of health conditions which can affect your driving](/health-conditions-and-driving "Health conditions and driving") to find out how to let DVLA know.

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form C1V and send it to the address on the form.

$D [Download 'C1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 260KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_179266.pdf "Download medical questionnaire' (PDF, 260KB)"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you have lymphoma - download the correct form if you need to let them know
title: Lymphoma and driving
